question:
A statement is given followed by two assumptions numbered I and II. You have to assume everything in the statement to be true and decide which of the given assumptions is are implicit in the statement.

Statement:

The demand for smartphones and laptops has increased substantially since the introduction of online classes in schools.

Assumptions:

I. People are buying smartphones and laptops to enable their children to attend online classes.

II. Desktop computers cannot be used to attend online classes.

Group - D 17/08/2022 (Evening)
option_1: Only assumption II is implicit
option_2: Only assumption I is implicit
option_3: Neither assumption I nor II is implicit
option_4: Both assumptions I and II are implicit
solution:
Assumption I:

“People are buying smartphones and laptops to enable their children to attend online classes.”

This is a logical assumption.

If the demand increased after the introduction of online classes, it is reasonable to assume that people are buying these devices to help their children participate in those classes.

So, Assumption I is implicit.

Assumption II:

“Desktop computers cannot be used to attend online classes.”

This is not implicit.

The statement never mentions desktop computers, nor does it compare them.

It only talks about smartphones and laptops; we cannot infer that desktops cannot be used.

So, Assumption II is not implicit.

Correct Answer: (b) Only assumption I is implicitBottom of Form

question:
Consider the given argument and decide which of the given assumptions is (are) implicit. Argument: Warning: Consumption of alcohol is injurious to health.

Assumptions:

This warning is not required.

2. Non-alcoholic people are healthy.

RRB ALP Tier - I 13/08/2018 (Morning)
option_1: Neither 1 nor 2 is implicit.
option_2: Both 1 and 2 are implicit.
option_3: Only assumption 1 is implicit.
option_4: Only assumption 2 is implicit.
solution:
Assumption 1:

“This warning is not required.”

This contradicts the purpose of the warning itself.

If someone gives a warning, it **implicitly assumes that the warning is required.

So, Assumption 1 is not implicit.

Assumption 2:

“Non-alcoholic people are healthy.”

This goes beyond what is stated.

The warning only says alcohol is injurious, but it does not make any claim about the health of non-drinkers.

So, Assumption 2 is also not implicit.

Correct Answer: (a) Neither 1 nor 2 is implicit.

question:
Consider the given statement true and decide which of the given assumptions is (are) implicit.

Statement:

A teacher tells a student, "if you don't finish your homework, you will not be allowed into the class”.

Assumptions:

Discipline is a way to create effective learning.

2. The teacher will be happy not to have a student who is not punctual in his work.

RRB ALP Tier - I 29/08/2018 (Morning)
option_1: Neither assumption I nor II is implicit.
option_2: Both assumptions I and II are implicit.
option_3: Only assumption I is implicit.
option_4: Only assumption II is implicit.
solution:
Assumption 1:

“Discipline is a way to create effective learning.”

This is a valid assumption.

By enforcing a rule (homework → class entry), the teacher is promoting discipline. This implies the belief that discipline is necessary for effective learning.

So, Assumption 1 is implicit.

Assumption 2:

“The teacher will be happy not to have a student who is not punctual in his work.”

This is a personal emotional assumption, not implied by the statement.

The teacher sets a rule, but there's no indication of emotion like happiness or satisfaction about excluding the student.

So, Assumption 2 is not implicit.

Correct Answer: (c) Only assumption I is implicit.Bottom of Form

question:
A statement is given followed by two assumptions numbered I and II. You have to assume everything in the statement to be true and decide which of the given assumptions is/are implicit in the statement.

Statement:

Please register for the event latest by 21 April to collect free passes. Passes will not be issued without valid address proof.

Assumptions:

I. Voter ID card is valid address proof.

II. Passes can be purchased at the venue.

Group - D 17/08/2022 (Morning)
option_1: Only assumption I is implicit
option_2: Both assumptions I and II are implicit
option_3: Neither assumption I nor II is implicit
option_4: Only assumption II is implicit
solution:
Assumption I:

"Voter ID card is valid address proof."

The statement does not mention any specific document, including voter ID.

So, we cannot assume that Voter ID is or isn’t valid in this context.

Thus, Assumption I is not implicit.

Assumption II:

"Passes can be purchased at the venue."

The statement only talks about free passes via registration, and says nothing about paid passes or availability at the venue.

So, Assumption II is also not implicit.

Correct Answer: (c) Neither assumption I nor II is implicit.

question:
A statement is given followed by two assumptions numbered I and II. You have to assume everything in the statement to be true and decide which of the given assumptions is/are implicit in the statement.

Statement:

Essay writing is an art. It requires an understanding of the subject as well as a command over the language to be able to write a good essay.

Assumptions:

I. Essays cannot be written without complete mastery over the subject.

II. Anyone with a good command over the language can write a good essay.

Group - D 18/08/2022 (Morning)
option_1: Only assumption II is implicit
option_2: Both assumptions I and II are implicit
option_3: Neither assumption I nor II is implicit
option_4: Only assumption I is implicit
solution:
Assumption I:

"Essays cannot be written without complete mastery over the subject."

The statement says “understanding” of the subject is needed — not complete mastery.

So this is an exaggeration of the original point.

Assumption I is not implicit.

Assumption II:

"Anyone with a good command over the language can write a good essay."

This ignores the need for understanding the subject, which is clearly stated in the statement.

So, even if someone has good language skills, they still need subject understanding too.

Assumption II is also not implicit.

Correct Answer: (c) Neither assumption I nor II is implicit.

question:
A statement is given followed by two assumptions numbered I and II. You have to assume everything in the statement to be true and decide which of the given assumptions is/are implicit in the statement.

Statement:

Due to the failure of the main grid, power supply to many parts of the city was affected.

Assumptions:

I. The main grid is responsible for transmission of power to different parts of the city.

II. Most people have backup power installations at their homes to manage during times when power supply is disrupted.

Group - D 18/08/2022 (Evening)
option_1: Only assumption II is implicit
option_2: Only assumption I is implicit
option_3: Both assumptions I and II are implicit
option_4: Neither assumption I nor II is implicit
solution:
Assumption I:

"The main grid is responsible for transmission of power to different parts of the city."

This is a logical assumption.

If failure of the main grid caused power disruption, it's reasonable to assume that it is the primary source or channel of power distribution in the city.

So, Assumption I is implicit.

Assumption II:

"Most people have backup power installations at their homes to manage during times when power supply is disrupted."

The statement says nothing about how people cope with the outage or whether they have backup power.

This is additional information not implied by the statement.

So, Assumption II is not implicit.

Correct Answer: (b) Only assumption I is implicit.

question:
A statement is given followed by two assumptions numbered I and II. Assuming the information given in the statement to be true, then state which of the given assumptions are implicit in the statement?

Statement:

The exterior walls of the building have several cracks, which need to be repaired before wall painting begins so that later problems like leakage do not have to be faced.

Assumptions:

I. Painting exterior walls can lead to seepage problems.

II. Leakage problems can occur due cracks in exterior walls.

Group - D 23/08/2022 (Morning)
option_1: Only assumption II is implicit
option_2: Neither assumption I nor II is implicit
option_3: Assumption I and II both are implicit
option_4: Only assumption I is implicit
solution:
Assumption I:

“Painting exterior walls can lead to seepage problems.”

Not implicit.

The statement doesn’t say that painting itself causes seepage or leakage.

It says leakage might happen if cracks are not repaired before painting.

So, the problem is the existing cracks, not the painting.

Assumption I is not implicit.

Assumption II:

“Leakage problems can occur due to cracks in exterior walls.”

Yes, this is implicit.

The statement explicitly says that cracks should be repaired before painting to avoid later problems like leakage.

This implies that cracks may cause leakage.

Assumption II is implicit.

Correct Answer: (a)Only assumption II is implicit.

question:
A statement is given followed by two assumptions numbered I and II. Assuming the information given in the statement to be true, you have to state which of the given assumptions are implicit in the statement?

Statement:

Bus services came to a complete standstill due to the strike by transport workers, due to which people could not reach their places of work.

Assumption:

I. Citizens should make more use of metro rail services.

II. Many people depend on bus services to reach their workplace.

Group - D 24/08/2022 (Evening)
option_1: Neither assumption I nor II is implicit
option_2: Only assumption I is implicit.
option_3: Both assumptions I and II are implicit
option_4: Only assumption II is implicit
solution:
Assumption I:

“Citizens should make more use of metro rail services.”

Not implicit.

The statement does not mention the metro, suggest it as an alternative, or even imply that it was available.

This is an external suggestion not contained in the logic of the statement.

So, Assumption I is not implicit.

Assumption II:

“Many people depend on bus services to reach their workplace.”

Yes, this is clearly implicit.

The statement says people couldn’t reach work because bus services stopped.

That means people rely on buses to commute to work.

So, Assumption II is implicit.

Correct Answer: (d) Only assumption II is implicit.

question:
A statement is given followed by two possible underlying assumptions I and II. Read all the information carefully and decide which of the given assumptions can be assumed by the given statement.

Statement:

Doctors suggest that for people who are deficient in Vitamin C and have a weakened digestive system, it is better to take Vitamin C supplements than to eat citrus fruits rich in Vitamin C.

Assumptions:

I. Anyone suffering from indigestion issues should stop eating citrus fruits.

II. The end result of both citric fruits and Vitamin C supplements is more or less similar

Group - D 26/08/2022 (Morning)
option_1: Both I and II can be assumed
option_2: Only II can be assumed
option_3: Neither I nor II can be assumed
option_4: Only I can be assumed
solution:
Assumption I:

"Anyone suffering from indigestion issues should stop eating citrus fruits."

This is too broad.

The statement talks about people who have both a Vitamin C deficiency and weak digestion, not all people with indigestion.

So, this assumption overgeneralizes and is not valid.

Assumption II:

"The end result of both citric fruits and Vitamin C supplements is more or less similar."

The statement does not claim that the results of both are similar — only that supplements are better in this particular case (due to digestion issues).

So, we cannot assume this similarity in effect.

Correct Answer: (c) Neither I nor II can be assumed.

question:
A statement is given followed by two possible implicit assumptions numbered I and II. Read all the information carefully, and decide which of the assumptions can be inferred from the given statements?

Statement:

Following the decision of country G, which was taken a decade ago to control pollution, country N has also decided to put a cap on the number of cars in the country. So, now if someone in country N wants to buy a car, they have to wait until someone in country N sells their car, or a car is not registered as completely non-functional and destroyed (scrap).

Assumptions:

I. Other transportation options in country N are sufficient to meet the needs of the country's non-car-owning population.

II. This decision is most likely to be successful in controlling pollution in country G.

Group - D 29/08/2022 (Evening)
option_1: neither I nor II can be inferred.
option_2: Only II can be inferred.
option_3: Both I and II can be inferred.
option_4: only I can be inferred.
solution:
Assumption I:

“Other transportation options in country N are sufficient to meet the needs of the country's non-car-owning population.”

Can be inferred.

  • If country N is limiting car ownership, it must be assuming that the people who cannot own cars will still be able to travel using other means.
  • Otherwise, this decision would be impractical and disruptive.

    So, this assumption is reasonably implicit.

Assumption II:

“This decision is most likely to be successful in controlling pollution in country G.”

Also can be inferred.

  • The statement says country N is following country G’s example, which was taken a decade ago to control pollution.
  • This implies that country N believes the measure was effective or at least worth emulating, which suggests success in G.

Correct Answer: (c) Both I and II can be inferred.

question:
A statement is given followed by two possible underlying assumptions I and II. Read all the information carefully and decide which of the given assumptions can be assumed by the given statement.

Statement:

Recent marketing trends suggest that words like ‘premium’, 'exquisite’, 'priority' are considered prestigious by consumers of the middle income group and hence increase the chances of sale of any product advertised with these words.

Assumptions:

I. The products advertised with the said 'prestigious' words definitely cost higher than those which are not advertised with such words.

II. Such prestigious words have no impact on sales among the lower income group.

Group - D 30/08/2022 (Morning)
option_1: Only I can be assumed
option_2: Only II can be assumed
option_3: Both I and II can be assumed
option_4: Neither I nor II can be assumed
solution:
Assumption I:

"The products advertised with the said 'prestigious' words definitely cost higher than those which are not advertised with such words."

Not implicit.

The statement is about perception and marketing language, not about actual pricing.

It does not claim that these products are definitely more expensive.

So this assumption is not necessarily true based on the statement.

Assumption II:

"Such prestigious words have no impact on sales among the lower income group."

Also not implicit.

The statement focuses only on the middle-income group.

It makes no mention of the lower-income group, so we cannot assume what impact these words might or might not have on them.

Correct Answer: (d) Neither I nor II can be assumed.

question:
A statement is given followed by two possible underlying assumptions I and II. Read all the information carefully and decide which of the given assumptions can be assumed by the given statement.

Statement:

Since Movie X has spent ₹3.6 crores in its promotion as against Movie R that spent only ₹1.3 crores, Movie X will definitely earn more at the box office.

Assumptions:

I. A movie that spends less than ₹1 crore on its promotion cannot do well at the box office.

II. Movie X may win more awards than Movie R.

Group - D 30/08/2022 (Afternoon)
option_1: Only I can be assumed
option_2: Both I and II can be assumed
option_3: Only II can be assumed
option_4: Neither I nor II can be assumed
solution:
Assumption I:

"A movie that spends less than ₹1 crore on its promotion cannot do well at the box office."

Not implicit.

The statement only compares ₹3.6 crore and ₹1.3 crore.

It does not set ₹1 crore as a threshold or make any claim about movies spending less than ₹1 crore.

So this is a generalization not supported by the given statement.

Assumption II:

"Movie X may win more awards than Movie R."

Also not implicit.

The statement only talks about box office earnings, not awards or critical acclaim.

So, awards are completely outside the scope of this statement.

Correct Answer: (d) Neither I nor II can be assumed.

question:
A statement is given followed by two possible underlying assumptions I and II. Read all the information carefully and decide which of the given assumptions can be assumed by the given statement.

Statement:

"If we promote our play in all the local newspapers before the end of this week, we will sell more tickets for our play this weekend."-- play director in City D.

Assumptions:

I. The newspaper companies in City D take less than a week to finalize advertisements and publish them.

II. Not many people in City D prefer watching plays.

Group - D 30/08/2022 (Evening)
option_1: Only I can be assumed
option_2: Both I and II can be assumed
option_3: Neither I nor II can be assumed
option_4: Only II can be assumed
solution:
Assumption I:

The newspaper companies in City D take less than a week to finalize advertisements and publish them.

Yes, this is implicit.

The plan assumes that newspapers can publish ads before the weekend.

If newspapers took more than a week, the plan wouldn’t work.

So, this assumption is logically necessary for the plan to succeed.

Assumption II:

Not many people in City D prefer watching plays.

This is not implicit.

  • If that were true, then advertising might not help.
  • But the director is confident that promotion will increase sales, which suggests that people are interested, or at least can be persuaded to attend.
  • So this assumption contradicts the intent of the statement and is not valid.

Final Answer: (a) Only I can be assumed.

question:
A statement followed by two assumptions I and II are given. You have to decide which of the given assumptions are implicit in the statement assuming all the information given in the statement to be true?

Statement:

Eating too much chocolate can cause tooth decay.

Assumptions:

I. Chocolate has high sugar content which can result in bacterial growth.

II. Brushing twice a day keeps teeth strong.

Group - D 01/09/2022 (Afternoon)
option_1: Neither assumption I nor II is implicit.
option_2: Both assumptions I and II are implicit.
option_3: Only assumption II is implicit.
option_4: Only assumption I is implicit.
solution:
Assumption I:

"Chocolate has high sugar content which can result in bacterial growth."

Implicit

  • This provides a reasonable explanation for why chocolate can cause tooth decay.
  • While not stated directly, the assumption supports the logic behind the statement — sugar promotes bacterial growth, leading to decay.

So, assumption I is logically connected and can be assumed.

Assumption II:

"Brushing twice a day keeps teeth strong."

Not implicit

  • The statement does not mention brushing habits or prevention.
  • The focus is solely on the negative effect of chocolate — not on what keeps teeth healthy.

So, assumption II is unrelated to the given statement.

Correct Answer: (d)Only assumption I is implicit.

question:
A statement is given followed by two assumptions numbered I and II. You have to assume everything in the statement to be true and decide which of the assumptions is/are implicit in the statement

Statement:

Increase in the tax rates will hurt the pockets of the salaried middle class

Assumptions:

I. Increase in the prices of goods will hurt the poor too.

II. The middle class will reduce their extra expenditure to save money

Group - D 02/09/2022 (Morning)
option_1: Only assumption I is implicit
option_2: Neither assumption I nor II is implicit
option_3: Both assumptions I and II are implicit
option_4: Only assumption II is implicit
solution:
Assumption I:

"Increase in the prices of goods will hurt the poor too."

Not implicit

  • The statement talks about tax increase, not about price rise or the poor.
  • It introduces a new topic (price of goods and the poor), which is not connected to the statement.

Assumption II:

"The middle class will reduce their extra expenditure to save money."

Implicit

  • If tax increases are hurting their pockets, it's reasonable to assume that they might cut down on extra expenses to manage their budget.
  • This assumption logically follows from the financial impact mentioned in the statement.

Correct Answer: (d)

Only assumption II is implicit.

question:
A statement followed by two assumptions I and II is given. You have to decide which of the given assumptions is/are implicit in the statement assuming all the information given in the statement to be true?

Statement:

Reading books will make you a morally good person.

Assumptions:

I. Reading books helps in acquiring knowledge.

II. All successful people read books.

Group - D 02/09/2022 (Afternoon)
option_1: Both assumptions I and II are implicit
option_2: Only assumption II Is implicit.
option_3: Only assumption I Is implicit.
option_4: Neither assumption I nor II is implicit.
solution:
Assumption I:

"Reading books helps in acquiring knowledge."

Not implicit

  • While this may be generally true, it is not linked in the statement.
  • The statement does not talk about knowledge as a benefit — only moral goodness is mentioned.
  • So, this assumption is outside the scope.

Assumption II:

"All successful people read books."

Not implicit

  • The statement says nothing about successful people.
  • This assumption brings in an external, unrelated idea and hence cannot be considered implicit.

Correct Answer: (d) Neither assumption I nor II is implicit.

question:
A statement is given followed by two assumptions numbered I and II. You have to assume everything in the Statement to be true and decide which of the assumptions is/are implicit in the statement.

Statement:

Driving on the wrong side of the road will lead to accidents.

Assumptions:

I. Driving slow will avoid accidents.

II. Following traffic rules will keep roads accident free.

Group - D 12/09/2022 (Evening)
option_1: Only assumption I is implicit
option_2: Only assumption II is implicit
option_3: Neither assumption I nor II is implicit
option_4: Both assumptions I and II are implicit
solution:
Assumption I:

"Driving slow will avoid accidents."

Not implicit

  • The statement does not mention speed at all.
  • Accidents here are related to rule violation, not speeding or slowing down.
  • So this assumption brings in a different factor not related to the core of the statement.

Assumption II:

"Following traffic rules will keep roads accident free."

Implicit

  • The statement shows that breaking a traffic rule (driving on the wrong side) leads to accidents.
  • Therefore, it is logical to assume that following traffic rules helps prevent accidents, which is what assumption II says.

Final Answer: (b) Only assumption II is implicit.

question:
A statement is given followed by two assumptions numbered I and II. You have to assume everything in the statement to be and decide which of the assumptions is/are implicit in the statement.

Statement:

"In order to retain employees, we must reward them with monthly benefits", company chairman tells the manager.

Assumptions:

I. Monthly benefits will keep the employees Happy.

II. The employees will be punctual.

Group - D 13/09/2022 (Morning)
option_1: Only assumption II is implicit
option_2: Both assumptions I and II are implicit
option_3: Only assumption I is implicit
option_4: Neither assumption I nor II is implicit
solution:
Assumption I:

"Monthly benefits will keep the employees happy."

Implicit

  • The chairman is suggesting monthly benefits as a means of retention.
  • For this to be effective, it must be assumed that employees feel happy/satisfied with such benefits.
  • Hence, assumption I is implicit.

Assumption II:

"The employees will be punctual."

Not implicit

  • The statement does not mention anything about punctuality.
  • The focus is entirely on employee retention through benefits, not on attendance or time discipline.
  • So this assumption is unrelated to the statement.

Correct Answer: (c) Only assumption I is implicit.

question:
A statement is given followed by two assumptions numbered I and II. You have to assume everything in the statement to be true and decide which of the assumptions is implicit in the statement.

statement:

Do not throw glass bottles in green dustbins which are meant for other recyclable waste items.

Assumptions:

l. Dustbins for collecting glass bottles are of a different colour than the dustbins used to collect other recyclable items.

ll. Glass bottles are to be thrown along with the non-recyclable waste.

Group - D 17/09/2022 (Afternoon)
option_1: Only assumption II is implicit
option_2: Neither assumptions I nor II is implicit
option_3: Both assumptions I and II are implicit
option_4: Only assumption I is implicit
solution:
Assumption I:

"Dustbins for collecting glass bottles are of a different colour than the dustbins used to collect other recyclable items."

Implicit

  • Since the statement says don’t throw glass bottles in green dustbins (meant for other recyclables), it implies that there must be a separate category/container for glass.
  • The differentiation by colour is a reasonable and necessary assumption in this context.

Assumption II:

"Glass bottles are to be thrown along with the non-recyclable waste."

Not implicit

  • The statement says don’t throw them in green bins meant for other recyclables, but it does NOT say that glass is non-recyclable or must be thrown with non-recyclables.
  • It’s entirely possible that glass is recyclable, just needs to be placed in a separate bin (e.g., a blue or white one).

Final Answer: (d) Only assumption I is implicit.

question:
A statement is given followed by two assumptions numbered I and II. You have to assume everything in the statement to be true and decide which of the assumptions is/are implicit in the statement.

Statement:

Children below the age of 5 years should not be allowed too much of screen time a day.

Assumptions:

I. Too much screen time for growing children will affect them adversely.

II. Limited screen time is not detrimental to children below 5 years of age.

Group - D 18/09/2022 (Morning)
option_1: Neither assumption I nor II is implicit
option_2: Only assumption I is implicit
option_3: Only assumption II is implicit
option_4: Both assumption I and II are implicit
solution:
Assumption I:

"Too much screen time for growing children will affect them adversely."

Implicit

  • This is directly aligned with the reason why the statement advises against too much screen time.
  • If there were no adverse effects, there would be no need for the restriction.

Assumption II:

"Limited screen time is not detrimental to children below 5 years of age."

Implicit

  • The statement specifically warns against "too much", which implicitly allows limited screen time.
  • If any amount of screen time was harmful, the statement would say no screen time at all.

Final Answer: (d) Both assumption I and II are implicit
